column4: results are here if this makes sense to anyone? http://pastebin.com/d750e09ef
my external hdd is no longer recognised - any ideas
ive tried testdisk and that doesnt recognise it either
tell the channel what filesystem its useing In such cases. because it will be needed info :)
you used a windows machine to scan/repair the disk yet?
if a ntfs is not cleanly 'removed' when using windows. linux wont mount/access it for 'safty' reasons
use windows to scan/fix the windows disk. not the ubuntu one.
windows no longer recognises the drive either which is why the tools wouldnt work
i just tried plugig the drive into another windows machine and t works fine (phew) but ubutu still wont recognise it - any suggestions what this could mean?
use winows to check/fix the drive.. ALWAYS use windows 'safely remove' feature.. dont hibernate/suspend windows with the thing plugged in
you just said windows saw it.
you could use the command line tools if you wanted to. but IF the drive is not cleanly removed by windows.. Ubuntu will NOT want to auto mount it.
also install/run the ntfs-config tools perhaps to enable full user access
you could set a mountpoint called whatever you want.
/media/windowsstuff
Hmm?
i got box's of keyboards. :) Rummage sales for $1 each.
thx for your help anyway - much appriciated
thers 'not seeing it' then theres 'not auto mounting it'
the system is seeing the hd if 'sudo fdisk -l' shows it.. it may not be auto mounting it for various reasons
could it be that another two drives have teh same letters assigned?
linux dostne use drive letter asignments like in widnows. each device has its own /dev/sdXX entry
